data.title: Refactored ScreenMap & improved perf of updates, removals and region lookups
data.body:
Reduce code duplication by extracting a common class to deal with spatial partitioning of actors, and use some (cached) delegates to reduce duplication further without affecting performance too much.

Speed up updates and removal of actors by caching their location so we only need to update or remove them from bins they are actually in (typically very few), compared to having to check every bin for removals which is much more work in comparison.

data.title: Expose turn-to-attack delay to yaml, v2
data.body: This is a revision of #7815. I only noticed that something was off about it while writing the changelog entry. sorry.

data.title: Removed map control from player statistics for performance reasons
data.body: Closes #7685.

data.title: Split TS rules for infantry, structures and vehicles
data.body: Less scrolling, more structured.

data.title: Cleaned up TS infantry and player structure sequences
Lower aircraft altitude
data.body:
In order to work around a problem where the game does not take aircrafts' altitude into account when deciding whether a unit should be rendered or not, leading to aircrafts seemingly (dis)appearing a couple of cells into the map instead of right at the lower edge of the map.

Planes will now fly at the default altitude of 1280, helicopters slightly below at 1024.

data.title: Removed AnnounceOnSeen from Red Alert and fixed Lint warnings
data.body: This removes the `Enemy Units Approaching` used for what is actually `Enemy unit detected` from the Red Alert mod as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7787#issuecomment-87780876. It can make it's return once it is polished and we've got a properly (cut together) announcer voice file.

data.title: Fixed parsing of hotkeys with no name (such as tilde)
data.body:
Quick fix to #7838
Keys with no name are parsed as numeric key codes (i.e. "126" for tilde)

data.title: Fix issues in gdi05a
data.body:
Fixes #7836.

Fixes tanks running over their own sandbag, and flame troopers, flame tanks and and mobile SAMs from being buildable.

data.title: OpenRA fails to parse some hotkeys (§,~,ä,ö)
data.body:
Any hotkeys that are displayed in the input menu with their SDL keycode (e.g. "126" instead "Tilde") aren't parsed properly on startup, they're reset back to defaults and finally  forgotten the next time you play.

Console output includes this line:

> FieldLoader: Cannot parse `126 None` into `GuardKey:Hotkey`; substituting default `D None`

Edit: just to clarify what this is about. This affects keyboards with some weird keys (a german or a scandinavic one will do). Any keys can be mapped via the ingame input menu and it works fine but as soon as the game is restarted the keybindings are reset.

data.title: Added transparency to the Tiberian Sun building placement overlay
data.body:
A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7811 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7806:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/6980916/8d999e08-d9f9-11e4-9368-885ea98c97c6.png)

data.title: Fixed make.ps1 'check' command
data.body: TilesetBuilder got removed.

data.title: Avoid preventable allocations
data.body:
Avoid some common allocations so the GC has less work to do. Reduces ongoing allocations on the RA shellmap by ~5%. Provides a very small perf win for CPU (~0.4%).

Also removes some code duplication and fixes some minor bugs in the AI where it wasn't accounting for invalid target types.

data.title: Generate and use mod file hashes for version checks.
data.body:
We should generate a mod hash in a similar way to how we do maps (concatenate all the yaml files, and then calculate the SHA1) and store this in the global ModMetadata struct.  We should then use this hash for compatibility checks instead of the version string.

This cuts out the "are we running {DEV_VERSION} or git-foo" overhead from organizing bleed games, and prevents players from unintentionally desyncing games by joining with modified rules.

Credit for the idea goes to @Phrohdoh.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10373160-generate-and-use-mod-file-hashes-for-version-checks?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Another cleanup.
data.body:
Remove explicit private.
Remove unnecessary delegate.
Use extension method syntax.
Fix HealthInfo.NotifyAppliedDamage’s desc.
Remove unused using directives.
Remove explicit type declaration in Manifest.

data.title: Fix crash in allies03b
data.body:
Fixes #7824.

To reproduce the crash, kill at least one of the e1s at the sandbag revetments between the first and second base before the jeep comes to a halt.

data.title: Added hotkeys for support powers
data.body:
Implemented hotkey logic for support powers (as requested in #7369) and UI items for configuring the hotkeys.
Also the hotkey is displayed in the support power tooltip in the same manner as unit/structure tooltips are.

data.title: Fix crash when placing buildings in TD
data.body:
Caused by production queues being tied to buildings, not the player, in TD.
PBOG would therefore try to find the `PlaceBuilding` trait, which is on the player, on the conyard actor and crash.

Fixes #7821.

data.title: Planes disappearing near the bottom map edge
data.body:
Migs and Yaks (other RA units seem to be fine) disappear (as if they were outside of the map) one or two tiles too early before reaching the **bottom edge.**

How to recreate:
- order a Yak/Mig toward the **bottom edge** of the map (right next to it)
- when it's approaching the edge (just a few tiles before) order it to move along the edge
- it will start its **turning animation** and disappear (the selection box remains around it)

It reappears moments later or if you move it further into the map.

![yak_under](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/6961389/d1960e4a-d92a-11e4-8195-4177647a8266.jpg)

data.title: remove NUnit
data.body:
NUnit is only taking up space. No one has really taken to unit testing and it's very clear that integrated testing is preferred. I don't see any reason to keep the extra dependencies and csproj around.

Revert #6797

data.title: Fix CellLayer.GetEnumerator
data.body:
You can cast an array, but not the enumerator (MS runtime, at least).

Doesn't actually affect the game, but debuggers that enumerate collections automatically for convenience will benefit since it will work now.

data.title: Ensure MapCache disposes cleanly.
data.body:
This prevents the map loading thread writing to disposed objects which can have unintended side effects.

Fixes #7248 - I have included more details and some reproduction steps against that issue if you need them.

data.title: Removed unused oldLength
data.body: Fixed #7808
